course_title: Special Topics in Bioethics: Artificial Intelligence&Ethics
class_notes: (Course Description: This course will offer a broad overview of a multitude of ethical challenges presented by contemporary AI technologies.  Topics to be studied and discussed will include algorithmic construction, using data for the public good, data privacy, algorithmic accuracy and bias, re-identification of data referents, sharing and selling data, data repurposing, integrity of the data user chain and regulatory concerns, data storage and access, the future of employment, cyberhacking and ransomware, and cyberwar/dystopian futures.  Registrations from multiple disciplines, e.g., humanities, computer science, bioinformatics, public health, health care, sociology, etc., are welcome and encouraged)
course_description: Topics and professors for the Bioethics elective change every semester.
sections: Class Nbr: 5347, Section #: 2, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: W 2:40-5:40p, Instructor: J. Banja, Status: Open
